intro: Hypericum fanjingense, commonly known as the Fanjing hypericum, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and is known for its medicinal properties. It has elliptical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
